title: Good Time Guys
text:
My husband and I had most wonderful 2 days on the beach!! We had to cancel our plans for Key West when Tropical Storm Nicole developed!! So, we came up with Plan B. Fortunately, we were able to book a unit at the last minute! We found the accommodations to be sparkling and well decorated with a beach theme. The pool and beach access just outside the door. It was slightly off season, so beach was not crowded. We enjoyed much relaxation and trying all the local restaurants! We ate our fill of seafood! We could have cooked in the well appointed kitchen or outside on the charcoal grill. We were too lazy for that!!

The bed was very comfortable! The blackout drapery was helpful to sleeping past sunrise.
This unit has 2.5 bathrooms, so my husband and I each had a bathroom. The linens were soft and snowy white. The washer and dryer were convenient and quiet. Likewise the dishwasher!! The appliances appeared new.
The refrigerator was spacious, although we only used it for our beverages. The ice maker was a lifesaver and the bin was full of ice when we arrived.

We didn’t watch much TV although their were several new ones, including a large one in the living room. We did make use of the WI-FI! 

We give the owners of the unit we rented high marks for providing a clean and attractive place for us! And right on the beach!!  In all likelihood we will stay there again!! Thank you!!

title: A tale of web and lies
text:
Once upon a time, there was a young man named Mark who had a great idea for a website. He wanted to create a platform where people could connect with each other and share their lives online. Mark worked tirelessly to build his website and soon it became very popular. People all over the world were using it to stay in touch with friends and family.
As the website grew, Mark became very wealthy and powerful. He was able to buy anything he wanted and do anything he pleased. But he also became very greedy and selfish. He started to use people’s personal information for his own gain, without their permission.
Despite the backlash he received from the public, Mark refused to take responsibility for his actions. He continued to use people’s personal information for his own gain and didn’t care about the consequences.
In the end, Mark became even more powerful and wealthy than before. He was able to buy out all of his competitors and become the most dominant force in the tech industry. But he was also very lonely and unhappy. He had no real friends or family left because he had betrayed them all.

title: Nothing loads anymore
text: I’ve been a faithful Facebook user for years. It is my go to social media platform and I love it. However for the last couple months I’ve noticed it won’t load random things. Images, comments, and video will stop loading if I’ve been scrolling for a minute or two. Sometimes I’ll be just hopping on and comments won’t load for something. It doesn’t matter if I’m on WiFi or data. I’ve even gone as far as to uninstall it and reinstall it twice this week, which worked for that night and stopped the next day. I never used to have this problem until after I got the iPhone X. My husband just switched phones to the iPhone X like me (got mine on Mother’s Day) and now he experiences it too, and we have friends who say they noticed it as well on this phone but when they switched phones, it was all good. Is there possibly a compatibility flaw between Facebook and the new iPhone? I hate not being able to use it like I used to. Hopefully this can be fixed so we can keep using it.

title: Used to be Great

The “fact checks” and FB notes on everything have truly become a hinderance from enjoying the app. Some of my friends will not even use it anymore because of all the BS. Let people judge information for themselves and have fun with their friends or start calling it Censored Media because it’s getting less and less social. I’m also pretty close to calling it quits with FB because I’m tired of my friends and I feeling we cannot communicate freely without FB looking at each and every one of our posts, even jokes, and pin pointing what is false about our posts. 95% of the time, the “fact-checkers” do not even provide facts that have anything to do with reason I posted what I did. Anyway, FB needs to figure out its priorities; is it to allow people to be social or is it to be information police. Defund the information police!

title: NEGATIVE 3 STARS: AI Blocking Out of Control
text:
I, and many other of my friends and family, have been placed in “Facebook Jail,” over posts that “go against community standards.” Here is my issue: NOTHING that has caused this has been against these standards, but these posts and comments are pinpointed by AI for “trigger words” (ie curse words). The problem is that AI is being triggered over what we type, though it is harmless, meanwhile memes that ARE against FB standards are being let through by this same AI system, because they are pictures and therefore not as heavily monitored. 

I truly wish there was a viable Facebook competitor, because they are truly awful; if I could give negative stars for the sole reason of their monitoring systems, I would. Unfortunately app review doesn’t allow that, so my negative rating is in the title. 

If you haven’t yet been sucked into Facebook to keep up with your friends, do yourself a favor and don’t even start. It isn’t what it used to be, and I contemplate getting rid of it daily, but it would cut out my friends from thousands of miles away, whom I can no longer see due to moving.

title: Not worth having on your phone

The posts you do see from people you sort of know are usually posts from your racist Trump supporting uncle, because those posts have gotten a lot of engagement (usually likes and hearts from your uncles racist friends, or because you  argued with them ONE TIME in the comments and now Facebook’s algorithm thinks you’re best buds and want to see even MORE of their racist garbage.) oh, and Facebook tracks you everywhere you go on the internet in order to collect lots of data on you so they they can know everything about you because they’re so sure you just love love love all those personalized ads the bombard you with.

title: Updating the App into Uselessness
text: I am a member of a lot of groups and rely on my email notifications to decide which posts to actually read and which to ignore. Unfortunately, FB made that impossible several months ago when, during an update, my email notifications suddenly became two lines instead of the full post. I’m assuming that was to force me to visit FB more often. What’s worse, is that in a recent update, when I click on the “view on Facebook” button in the email notification, instead of taking me directly to the post I want to read, FB now takes me to a random video in the FB watch tab. Presumably to get me to watch more videos. But all it’s doing is frustrating me to no end. Now, the latest, is when I manually try to find the post I want to read by looking at my notifications tab, the post doesn’t show up until I refresh the group page, which never used to be the case. It is all a downward spiral that makes me wish I could just stop using FB and try something else. Stop updating the app to make it less convenient for users!

title: Comment Section
text: This new update where you are watching a reel or a video and you tap the comments button to read them, I do not like. Instead of tapping the button and it takes you to the comments to read, the video now becomes smaller and continues to play. If you try to tap the video to pause it, it just makes the video the original size and continues to play. Why would someone want a video they just watched, to keep playing as they’re trying to read the comments? Now you have to tap the “add comment” box at the bottom of the video to at least cover the video but you also have remove the “add comment” box first to get a full view of the comments. That’s not even a guarantee that the video will continue to stay paused during that time either. Sometimes you’ll scroll only a few comments down and the video will start to play again on its own. Can you please fix this? It is very annoying and ruining the Facebook experience.

title: Bad First Impression
text: I have never heard a good thing about Facebook so I’ve never bothered to make an account. That said, due to school and broader socialization opportunities, I finally felt the need to make an account. After finalizing my account and verifying all of the information with the many codes sent, it only took about 40 minutes for them to suspend my account. They claimed their computer software detected inauthenticity even though I allowed their app access to all of my photos, email address, contacts, and phone number. All of these same details can easily be linked to my Instagram account (which is also owned by Meta), but somehow their computer software was incapable of doing so and jumped to a radical conclusion that I wasn’t real. I sent an appeal (which involved sending them a live video of my face turning left and right… very uncomfortable), and won’t hear back for another 2 days. After hearing nothing but complaints from people in my life about FaceBook and their creepy invasiveness, this solidifies the distaste I have for this company. They have very much failed their first impression on me.
